originalTitle: Ex-president accused of murder plot expelled from Togo to Burkina Faso
title: A Big Story About a Former Leader in Africa!
content:
Hello, hello, my wonderful young friends across Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here, ready to share an exciting and important story from our big, beautiful continent! Today, we're going to talk about something that happened between two of our amazing countries: Togo and Burkina Faso. It's about a special person who used to be a leader, and what happened to him.

Meet Our Countries: Burkina Faso!

First, let's learn a little bit about one of the countries in our story: Burkina Faso! It's a lovely country in West Africa. Imagine a place with lots of sunshine and friendly people! Burkina Faso is known for its kind people and vibrant culture. People there love music and art. It's a place where many different languages are spoken, but everyone understands the language of friendship! Did you know? The name "Burkina Faso" means "Land of the Upright People" or "Land of Incorruptible People." Isn't that a wonderful name? It shows how proud and honest the people are!

Meet Our Countries: Togo!

Now, let's learn about the other country in our story: Togo! Togo is also in West Africa, right next to the big, blue Atlantic Ocean. This means it has beautiful beaches! Togo is a country with rich history and lovely traditions. People there enjoy delicious food and colourful festivals. It's a smaller country, but full of big hearts and warm smiles. Did you know? Togo is famous for its lively markets where you can find all sorts of interesting things, from beautiful fabrics to tasty fruits! It's like a treasure hunt every day!

Who is Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba?

Now, let's talk about the special person in our story. His name is Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba. That's a long name, isn't it? He used to be a very important leader in Burkina Faso. What does a leader do? Well, a leader is like the head teacher of a school, but for a whole country! They help make big decisions to keep everyone safe and happy. They make rules and plans for the country. Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba was once the president of Burkina Faso. A president is the main leader. But he is not the president anymore. We call him an "ex-president" because "ex" means "former" or "not anymore."

What Does "Accused" Mean?

Sometimes, people say that someone did something wrong. This is called being "accused." It's like when your friend says, "You took my toy!" even if you didn't. It's just what someone *said*, not necessarily what happened. In our story, some people in Burkina Faso *accused* Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba of something very serious. They said he was planning something very bad. Did you know? It's very important to remember that when someone is accused, it doesn't mean it's true right away. People need to check the facts and see what really happened!

A Serious "Plan"

The people in Burkina Faso said Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba was planning something called a "murder plot." This means they believed he was planning to hurt people very badly. This is a very serious thing to say. But we must remember something very important! Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba has not said anything about these accusations. He has not told his side of the story yet. So, it's like a puzzle piece that is still missing. Did you know? Leaders in countries have a lot of power, but they also have a lot of rules to follow. These rules help make sure everything is fair and safe for everyone in the country.

What Does "Expelled" Mean?

So, what happened next? Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba was in Togo. But then, he was "expelled." What does that big word mean? "Expelled" means he was asked to leave Togo. It's like if you were visiting a friend's house, and your friend's parents said, "It's time for you to go home now." He had to leave Togo and go somewhere else. Where did he go? He was sent from Togo to Burkina Faso. So, he went back to the country where he used to be a leader. This was a very big journey and a big change for him.

Why Did This Happen?

This all happened because of the accusations from Burkina Faso. When someone is accused of something very serious, countries sometimes make big decisions about where that person can stay. The leaders in Togo decided that because of these serious accusations, it was best for Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba to leave their country and go to Burkina Faso. It was a decision made for the peace and safety of both countries. Did you know? Countries often work together, like good neighbors. They talk to each other and sometimes help each other with big situations, just like this one.

What Happens Next?

Now that Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba is back in Burkina Faso, the people there will continue to look into the accusations. They will try to understand what really happened and why. It's a big story, but it reminds us that being a leader is a very important job. Leaders need to be fair and kind, and always work for the good of their people. And everyone, even former leaders, must follow the rules. Did you know? Learning about news from different countries helps us understand our world better and become smarter, kinder citizens of Africa!

Always Be Kind!

So, my young friends, that's our story for today. It's a reminder that even when big things happen, it's important to be fair, listen to everyone, and always strive for peace and kindness in our homes, our schools, and our wonderful countries. Keep learning, keep exploring, and keep being the amazing future leaders of Africa! Until next time, stay curious and stay kind!
summary: Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, a former leader from Burkina Faso, was accused of a very serious plan by people in his home country, and because of this, he was asked to leave Togo and go back to Burkina Faso.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows how important it is for leaders to be fair and follow rules, and how countries work together when big things happen, helping everyone stay safe.

title: Refs' boss Webb backs officials over Dalot incident
